title: [BUG] Crash when clearing failed uploads
body:
Similar to https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2563

### Actual behaviour
- App crashes when clearing failed uploads.

### Expected behaviour
- App should behave normally when clearing failed uploads.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Upload a file.
2. Turn off wifi to make the upload fail.
2. Go to uploads view.
3. Tap three dots button and press "Clear failed".

### Environment data
Android version: 7.1.2

Device model: Nexus 6P

Stock or customized system: Stock

ownCloud app version: 2.11 beta

ownCloud server version: 10.0.10

### Logs

#### ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log)
```
2019-06-06 09:26:05.137 15480-15480/com.owncloud.android.debug E/AndroidRuntime: FATAL EXCEPTION: main
    Process: com.owncloud.android.debug, PID: 15480
    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Selection not allowed, use parameterized queries
        at com.owncloud.android.providers.FileContentProvider.delete(FileContentProvider.java:272)
        at com.owncloud.android.providers.FileContentProvider.delete(FileContentProvider.java:261)
        at android.content.ContentProvider$Transport.delete(ContentProvider.java:340)
        at android.content.ContentResolver.delete(ContentResolver.java:1373)
        at com.owncloud.android.datamodel.UploadsStorageManager.clearFailedButNotDelayedForWifiUploads(UploadsStorageManager.java:429)
        at com.owncloud.android.ui.activity.UploadListActivity.onOptionsItemSelected(UploadListActivity.java:206)
        at android.app.Activity.onMenuItemSelected(Activity.java:3207)
        at androidx.fragment.app.FragmentActivity.onMenuItemSelected(FragmentActivity.java:436)
        at androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity.onMenuItemSelected(AppCompatActivity.java:196)
        at androidx.appcompat.view.WindowCallbackWrapper.onMenuItemSelected(WindowCallbackWrapper.java:109)
        at androidx.appcompat.view.WindowCallbackWrapper.onMenuItemSelected(WindowCallbackWrapper.java:109)
        at androidx.appcompat.app.ToolbarActionBar$2.onMenuItemClick(ToolbarActionBar.java:64)
        at androidx.appcompat.widget.Toolbar$1.onMenuItemClick(Toolbar.java:204)
        at androidx.appcompat.widget.ActionMenuView$MenuBuilderCallback.onMenuItemSelected(ActionMenuView.java:781)
        at androidx.appcompat.view.menu.MenuBuilder.dispatchMenuItemSelected(MenuBuilder.java:840)
        at androidx.appcompat.view.menu.MenuItemImpl.invoke(MenuItemImpl.java:158)
        at androidx.appcompat.view.menu.MenuBuilder.performItemAction(MenuBuilder.java:991)
        at androidx.appcompat.view.menu.MenuPopup.onItemClick(MenuPopup.java:128)
        at android.widget.AdapterView.performItemClick(AdapterView.java:310)
        at android.widget.AbsListView.performItemClick(AbsListView.java:1164)
        at android.widget.AbsListView$PerformClick.run(AbsListView.java:3132)
        at android.widget.AbsListView$3.run(AbsListView.java:4047)
        at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:751)
        at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:95)
        at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:154)
        at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:6121)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
        at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:889)
        at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:779)
```

App

title: [BUG] [New Arch] Small glitch when editing folder permissions in public links
body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. Create a public link over a folder, and set a password
2. Edit the public link, and change the permission


### Current behaviour
The password textview disappears

![Jun-05-2019 15-51-08](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14894746/58961703-00da3000-87aa-11e9-8f7f-682d36befb72.gif)


### Expected behaviour
The password textview does not disappear

Android 9

title: Clear successful / failed uploads bug fix
body: Fix to issue #2563.

title: [New architecture] Improve viewmodel behaviour
body:
There's some scenarios in which we are sharing the livedata between different operations (getShares, createShares, removeShares()) , triggering some sort of duplicated calls when there's a successful operation for example. The app works fine so far but I think this approach may be improved.

The basic implementation of a viewmodel is based on a livedata that is explicitly used to get the data, not to edit or even delete it, since for those cases the changes should be automatically propagated to that livedata. 

Why are we using livedata for more cases apart from getting shares? Because we need to propagate network errors to UI for instance and that's not a basic case.

It would be great to work on splitting up the class responsible for warning the active observers into different ones so that creation and edition/deletion/other operations can be easily distinguishable and do not interfere between them.

- [x] Duplicate NetworkBoundResources: separate getShares and other operations
- [x] Check tests
- [x] QA will be done in https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/2558

### PR
App: https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/2569

title: Fix batched permission errors
body: Fix #2471 , code from https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/2474

title: [BUG] Crash when clearing successful uploads
body:
### Actual behaviour
- App crashes when clearing successful uploads.

### Expected behaviour
- App should behave normally when clearing successful uploads.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Upload a file.
2. Wait till is completed.
2. Go to uploads view.
3. Tap three dots button and press "Clear successful".

### Environment data
Android version: 9

Device model: Google Pixel 2

Stock or customized system: Stock

ownCloud app version: 2.11 beta

ownCloud server version: 10.0.10

title: [BUG] Crash when starting FileUploader (reported in Google Play)
body:
### Actual behaviour
- Crash when starting file uploader

### Expected behaviour
- Start file uploader should work without any crash
 
### Steps to reproduce
Not defined yet, but it's most likely related to uploads in background. It needs an additional research. 

### Environment data
Android version: 7.0 (90% of total reports)

Device model: Motorola DROID Turbo 2

ownCloud app version: 2.10.1

ownCloud server version: unknown

title: [BUG] Crash triggered by RemoteServiceException (reported in Google Play)
body:
### Actual behaviour
- Crash with no additional information. To be researched.

### Expected behaviour
- No crash

### Steps to reproduce
1. Not defined yet, Google Play report does not show additional details, but there's some people dealing with the same error on StackOverflow. Likely related to the start of foreground services. (https://stackoverflow.com/questions/50131759/remoteserviceexception-error)

### Environment data
Android version: 9 (90% of total reports)

Device model: OnePlus OnePlus6T (OnePlus6T)

ownCloud app version: 2.10.1

ownCloud server version: unknown

### Logs
#### ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log)
```
android.app.RemoteServiceException: 
  at android.app.ActivityThread$H.handleMessage (ActivityThread.java:1804)
  at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage (Handler.java:106)
  at android.os.Looper.loop (Looper.java:164)
  at android.app.ActivityThread.main (ActivityThread.java:6558)
  at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke (Native Method)
  at com.android.internal.os.RuntimeInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run (RuntimeInit.java:469)
  at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main (ZygoteInit.java:826)
```

Possible useful logs: 
```
Context.startForegroundService() did not then call Service.startForeground(): ServiceRecord{24fee0 u0 com.owncloud.android/.files.services.FileUploader}
```

title: [New architecture] Get + search + create private shares
body:
Private share creation (including users and group search) 

- Open search view
- Search sharee (capabilities). Internal & Federated. 
- Create & Show results
- Permissions depending on file/folder
- Unit/UI tests: https://github.com/owncloud/QA/blob/master/Mobile/Android/Release_2.12.0/2584-new_architecture_create_search_shares.md

### TASKS

1. Get and show private shares in list
    - [x] Implement get private shares and show it in private share list
    - [x] Show private shares in search dialog
    - [x] Unit Tests for getting private shares (non instrumented)
    - [x] Unit Tests for getting private shares
    - [x] UI Tests for showing private shares
      - [x] ShareFileFragment
      - [x] SearchShareesFragment

2. Search and show private shares found
    - [x] Create ShareesRepository
    - [x] Move the operation to get sharees from `UsersAndGroupsSearchProvider` to a new repository.
    - [x] Show the sharees retrieved from the server.
    - [x] Unit tests
    - [ ] UI tests, including flow ones => delayed till end to end tests

3. Create private shares
   - [x] Include insertPrivateSharee method in OCShareRepository
   - [x] Include insertPrivateSharee method in OCShareViewModel
   - [x] Call insertPrivateSharee from ShareActivity
   - [x] Unit tests
   - [ ] UI tests => delayed till end to end tests

4. Code review
5. QA: https://github.com/owncloud/QA/blob/master/Mobile/Android/Release_2.12.0/2584-new_architecture_create_search_shares.md

### PRs
- App: https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/2584
- Library: https://github.com/owncloud/android-library/pull/254

title: [BUG] Directories with '[' and ']' don't display content in app
body:
### Actual behaviour
- Enter directory with '[' or ']' in its name (e.g. "My Folder [2019]")
- Displays empty directory message (doesn't show content)

### Expected behaviour
- Directory content should be displayed
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Create directory with the above name format (e.g. "My Folder [2019]") in OwnCloud desktop or web interface
2. Navigate to the new directory in the android app
3. Directory content is not displayed


Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?
(url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test)

Cannot create directory in android app using the test server.

### Environment data
Android version:

Device model: 
Samsung Galaxy S10+
Stock or customized system:
Stock
ownCloud app version:
2.10.1
ownCloud server version:
10.1.1

body:
### TASKS:
 - [x] Merge 2.10.1 into master
 - [x] [COORDINATION] Get in touch with community/marketing team to publish a blog post, several days before releasing.
 - [x] [GIT] Create **release/1.0.1_beta.1** branch in owncloud/android-library from master
         - Update version code and name in build.gradle.
 - [x] [GIT] Create **release/2.11.0_beta.1** branch from master and:  
         - Update version code and name in build.gradle.
         - Update changelog file (< 500 chars)
 - [x] [QA] Perform some tests @jesmrec
 - [x] [GIT] Create and sign tag `1.0.1-beta.1` in HEAD commit of **release/1.0.1_beta.1** branch, in owncloud/android-library

 - [x] [DIS] Generate test APKs files from **release/2.11.0_beta.1** branch in owncloud/android 
- [x] [DOC] Include new changelog on Releases section of github android repo by drafting the new pre-release 2.11.0 beta
 - [x] [DIS] Generate final APK files from signed commit in owncloud/android and perform some basic operations
_____
### PLAY STORE:
 - [x] [DIS] Upload & publish beta release APK and changelog
_____
### F-DROID:

 - [x] [SPREADTHEWORD] Write a topic in central about the beta release.  https://central.owncloud.org/t/owncloud-2-11-beta-app-for-android

title: [BUG] Just created folder disappears when synchronizing parent folder
body: ### Actual behaviour Just created folder disappears when synchronizing parent folder and reappears during the next synchronization ### Expected behaviour Just created folder should not disappear ### Steps to reproduce 1. Create new folder 2. Just created folder is shown successfully 3. Pull down to sync the parent folder 4. Just created folder disappears 5. Pull down again to sync the parent folder 6. Just created folder reappears [](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/57215733-16630b00-6fee-11e9-8a98-6fa8099117ec.gif) ### Environment data Android version: 8.1 Device model: Nexus 5X Stock or customized system: Stock ownCloud app version: 2.10 ownCloud server version: 10.0.10 (stable) ### PR App: https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/2559

title: Update issue templates
body:
I've just created new issue templates from the old ones and placed them under `.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE` folder as [About issue and pull request templates](https://help.github.com/en/articles/about-issue-and-pull-request-templates) suggests. This way they'll be available for contributors/us to use when opening new issues in the repository, instead of using manual copy-paste, as we did with release template for example.

This is how the issues view in our repo should look like from now on

![new-issue-page-with-multiple-templates](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/56731667-5529d300-675b-11e9-860b-ec99d8ca7b6e.png)

I've replaced the old templates with three new ones (Feature request, bug report and release issue), please have a look at them and suggest whatever you consider.

CC / @jesmrec @michaelstingl @abelgardep

title: Update password when sharing via link doesn't work
body:
### Actual behaviour
- Password is not updated nor disabled.

### Expected behaviour
- Password is updated or disabled.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Open view to share a file
2. Create a public link with password
3. Edit the public link created in previous step and update the password or disable it

Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?
(url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test)
Yes

### Environment data
Android version: 8.1

Device model: Nexus 5X

Stock or customized system: Stock

ownCloud app version: 2.10.0

ownCloud server version: 10.0.10 (stable)

title: [New arch] App modularization and decoupling
body:
The status of the app and its code is a recurrent topic that's been discussed several times. A couple of months ago we started to work on a [new architecture](https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2351) that is transforming the app to be more testable, robust and future proof. 

Thanks to this new architecture, we should manage to have an app with much less dependencies but sometimes it's not easy to know and control, even less in an app as huge as ownCloud for Android.

So let's go through several solutions to modularize and decouple the app

### **Modularization with layers approach**

- Diagram
![2 3  oC app modules diagram_resized](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/61300732-d33dc900-a7e2-11e9-8ecc-b956219d59ad.png)

- Advantages:
  - Scalability: several developers working independently in different modules.
  - Maintainability: gradle can build modules faster since the classes and resources are separated in different modules. CI builds will be accelerated too.
  - Less tests to run when there's a new change: we need to run the tests in the module affected by that change and anything else that depends on it. We do not need to run all the tests if other modules are not impacted by the changes.
  - Reduce dependencies => less coupled code.
  - SWITCH MODULES: if in the future we want an app with a different UI and a different way to handle the information to show, we would just need to replace the :ownCloudApp module. And the same for the rest of modules, if one day we want to handle data differently to the current implementation, replacing the :ownCloudData module should be enough.

- Video: https://youtu.be/PZBg5DIzNww

-----------------------------------------------

### OTHER TOOLS

I've found an open source tool called [Apk dependency graph](https://github.com/alexzaitsev/apk-dependency-graph) that could help us a lot on this matter.

This is how the **dependency graph for the ownCloud Android app** looks like, based on [New arch - capabilities branch](https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/2508) (I put it live in https://davigonz.github.io/oCAndroidDependencyGraph/ so everyone can play with it) :

![Screenshot 2019-04-24 at 18 31 14](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/56676690-29590f80-66bf-11e9-9a45-32b18ce15a3a.png)

Above we can notice some parts of new architecture (OCShareRepository, OCShareViewModel, OCCapabilityRepository, OCCapabilityViewModel...) along with old code.

And below there's an example of a **good architecture with low class coupling**:

![Screenshot 2019-04-24 at 18 33 25](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/56676844-776e1300-66bf-11e9-99f4-709ee75b9901.png)

Taking into account [this diagram](https://davigonz.github.io/oCAndroidDependencyGraph/) while working on the new architecture would be great and will allow us to have a higher level vision and complete the whole app transformation process. 

So we could use this issue as an epic and create possible changes that come to our mind after having a look at the diagram.

Note: the diagram is currently hosted as a webpage in https://davigonz.github.io/oCAndroidDependencyGraph/ and it uses [this repo](https://github.com/davigonz/oCAndroidDependencyGraph) but we could move it with the rest of ownCloud repositories and even update the diagram via some kind of script included in bitrise (not sure if is possible, need to be checked) and have it updated with new arch changes. 

CC / @michaelstingl @jesmrec @abelgardep @hosy 

@owncloud/ios-core-developers you have something similar for iOS as well => https://github.com/PaulTaykalo/objc-dependency-visualizer

title: [Document Provider] Account management & Multiaccount
body:
This is the current behaviour after installing the app from scratch

1. Add one account to ownCloud  app -> account appears in Files (OK)
2. Add a second (or more) accounts to ownCloud app -> accounts do not appear in Files (NOK, should appear as many accounts as the ones attached to the app)
3. Delete from the app the account added in 1. -> the account is still available in Files (NOK, the account is removed)

As improvement, the account is displayed with the user name, but it would be nice to use the display name, if feasible.

title: Authentication lost daily
body:
### Actual behaviour
App asks me to authenticate again each morning.

### Expected behaviour
App should remember the authentication token.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Log in to my organisation's OwnCloud
2. Use normally for today.
3. Wake up next morning, open app.
4. Observe Snackbar: _Authentication failed -- Change account_
5. Go to _Manage Accounts_, hit key icon and authenticate again.
6. Use normally for today.
7. Wait for tomorrow, see it fail again.

This started to happen about one or two weeks ago. Our IT help desk said they upgraded the server at that time, so I'm not sure whether it's a server or client issue.

Also not sure if it's related to #2356.

Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?
I haven't tried yet.
(url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test)


### Environment data
Android version: 9 

Device model: OnePlus 5

Stock or customized system: LineageOS 16.0

ownCloud app version: 2.10.0 from F-Droid

ownCloud server version: 10.1.0.4

OAuth2 version: 0.4.0

### Logs
#### Web server error log
```
Hard to get them from my IT dept
```

#### ownCloud log (data/owncloud.log)
Could not locate `data/owncloud.log`. Fetched straight from logcat.
```
04-02 09:20:23.720 25558 25575 V AccountAuthenticator: Refreshing token!
04-02 09:20:23.720 25558 25575 D OwnCloudClient #1139: Creating OwnCloudClient
04-02 09:20:23.721 25558 25575 D OwnCloudClient: Executing PostMethod in request with id xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx-xxxxxxx
04-02 09:20:23.969 25558 25575 D OAuth2RefreshAccessTokenOperation: OAUTH2: raw response from POST TOKEN: {"error":"invalid_grant"}
04-02 09:20:23.969 25558 25575 E AccountAuthenticator: Failed to refresh access token
```

title: Code of conduct to be included
body:
Currently, ownCloud has the following code of conduct:

https://owncloud.org/community/code-of-conduct/

We should include it in the current repository, somewhere referring the community. 

Different options:

1.- Include the code of conduct as a separate link in the root (such as `CONTRIBUTING.md`, `README.md`...) 
2.- Integrate it in the `CONTRIBUTING.md` as new entry, including some guidelines about the procedure to handle the repo, like the reasons we are using `rebase` instead of `merge `etc...
3.- other approaches like this one from WWDC: https://github.com/insidegui/WWDC/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md  suggested by @michaelstingl 

CC @davigonz @abelgardep

Taking advantage of the isolation of `Settings` as `PreferenceActivity`, UI tests can be created over such activity.

Settings section contains three main blocks:

- Camera Uploads
- Security
- More

Tests over these sections can be addressed separately.

BUGS & IMPROVEMENT

title: Transifex behaviour improved
body:
Currently, transifex is pushing every day new commits to `master` when new translations are available. 

We do not really need new translations every day, since we release a new version bimonthly (more or less), and all new transifex commits make become active branches outdated. 

So, we can go for a similar approach that the iOS app: create a transifex branch with the translations that will be merged just before every release.

We have to agree:

- A name for the new branch
- Changes in drone, so it won't merge to master anymore
- A merging policy for translations (every week, every month, every release...) 

Maybe another choice is changing drone frequency

title: Preview for PDF files
body:
### Actual behaviour
On opening a PDF file the file is downloaded automatically.

### Expected behaviour
Instead the file should be opened for preview and and option should be provided to the user to download the file.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1.  Open any PDF file

Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?
(url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test)
Yes

title: Use Play Store description for F-Droid
body:
Fixes https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/2267#discussion_r265654755

Can someone please look up what short descriptions are set in the Play Store (English and German)?

title: App crashes when sharing files with ownCloud and creating new folder
body:
### Actual behaviour
- App crashes.

### Expected behaviour
- Folder creation properly performed.
 
### Steps to reproduce
1. Open a file browser.
2. Select a file and share with ownCloud.
3. Tap three dots and New Folder option.


### Environment data
Android version: 9

Device model: Google Pixel 3 XL

Stock or customized system: Stock

ownCloud app version: 2.10.0

ownCloud server version: not relevant 

### PR
https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/2490

title: [Document Provider] Rename Document
body:
New improvement to Document Provider : [Rename Document](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/provider/DocumentsContract.html#renameDocument(android.content.ContentResolver,%20android.net.Uri,%20java.lang.String))

| Actual behaviour | Expected behaviour | 
| ------------- |-------------| 
| ![ActualBehaviour](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47524927/54682482-55590200-4b0f-11e9-8c86-a2d038cd4125.png) | ![DocProviderRenameOption](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47524927/54682204-8e44a700-4b0e-11e9-8821-a8f6dbb49ee5.gif) |

### TASKS

- [x] Migrate current Document Provider and related files to Kotlin
- [x] Add rename functionality to Document Provider

### PR

https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/2506

title: After deleting log history, no extra logs are printed
body:
In debug mode


### Steps to reproduce

1. Go to Settings
2. Open Logs and delete history
3. Perform some actions in the app, so new logs will be made up
4. Open logs in Settings again

### Current behaviour

Logs empty

### Expected behaviour

Logs not empty

Reproduced with Android 9 and Android 8.

NOTE: By rebooting the device, logs are there again.

title: Document provider under investigation
body:
- [x] Research about [document provider docs](https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/providers/document-provider) and [the current oC implementation](https://github.com/owncloud/android/blob/master/owncloudApp/src/main/java/com/owncloud/android/providers/DocumentsStorageProvider.java) and define pending scenarios that could be interesting to be added in the ownCloud app for Android.

- [x] Create a small app in Kotlin to take the first steps with document providers.

title: Folder with brackets [ ] does not show the content
body:
### Steps to reproduce
1.  In web UI create a folder called [Photos] and upload something inside
2. In the app, open the folder 

### Actual behaviour
Content empty

### Expected behaviour
Content shown

Android 7 
ownCloud 10.0.10

-------

### TASKS

- [x] Research

  - [x] Create new tag with the fix
  - [x] Use tag in oC Android library
  - [x] Clean up dependencies
  - [] Send PR to dav4jvm with the bug report and fix https://gitlab.com/bitfireAT/dav4jvm/merge_requests/5
- [x] Design test plan -> not needed in this case. 
- [X] QA
- [ ] Merge branch feature/feature_name into master

### PR

- App https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/2533
- Library (if needed) https://github.com/owncloud/android-library/pull/248

title: Make brandable the option to click in commit hash
body:
After https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/2408, commit hash is shown in `Setting` to track the exact installed version. By clicking on it, you can go directly to github to get the commit.

We need the clicking option to be brandable, with a default of `yes`

title: Canceling dialog in settings turns on setting
body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. Open settings
2. Click on "Touches with other visible windows"
3. Cancel the dialog by clicking somewhere outside the dialog
4. Touches with other visible windows is now turned on


Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?
(url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test)
This is most likely a client-only issue.

### Environment data
Android version: 7.1.2

Device model: Oneplus X

Stock or customized system: Lineage 14

ownCloud app version: 2.1.0

ownCloud server version: 10

### PR
https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/2492
https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/2491

title: UI glitch in warning icon used to show errors when sharing a file publicly
body: ### Actual behaviour The warning icon used to show errors when sharing a file publicly is almost not visible due to the white color used. This warning icon is the same resource that we use in the login view and it needs to be white, so changing the color here will not solve the problem, use new resource maybe? [](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/54031539-543ee100-41af-11e9-9c04-a75b6c5b8900.png) ### Expected behaviour Warning icon should appear in grey color. [](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15261363/54032086-e85d7800-41b0-11e9-8632-ba5c5d01e4ea.png) ### Steps to reproduce 1. Disable wifi 2. Long press a file 3. Press share option 4. Create new public link 5. Save share Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server? Yes (url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test) ### Environment data Android version: 9.0 Device model: Google Pixel Stock or customized system: Stock ownCloud app version: 2.10.0 ownCloud server version: 10.0.10

title: Release 2.10.0 oem
body:
Implements:

- Include TLSv1.2 support and make it work on 19 devices: https://github.com/owncloud/android-library/issues/236
- Make brandable the option to click in commit hash: #2480
- Update Android dependencies to API 28 in Travis

Needs https://github.com/owncloud/android-library/pull/243

**IMPORTANT**: tag `oc-android-2.10.0_oem` in this branch

title: Batched permission errors when deleting if you are not granted
body:
This is something like: https://github.com/owncloud/android/issues/2335

Here the steps are:

1. Share a folder with another user. Do not grant to delete
2. Sharee opens the folder  in the account and try to remove several files by multiselecting

Current: an snackbar appears from each file that is not allowed to be removed
Expected: only one snackbar 

### PRs
App: https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/2564

title: Name conflicting in some actions is not consistent
body:
The policy in case of name conflicts is not consistent with these actions:

- Copy: If you copy an item inside the same directory, nothing happens. 

- Upload: If you download twice the same file inside the same folder, file is uploaded twice with a serial increment number (`file.txt`and `file(2).txt`)

- Rename/Move: if you rename or move an item in any folder that contains another item with the same name, it is not allowed and shown as an error.

We should unify criteria and put the same policy in every action.

CC @michaelstingl @davigonz @abelgardep
